Sentencas: Metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are considered to have a high potential for use in mobile applications.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: However, there are still technical problems to be solved.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Especially the interdiffusion of iron, chromium and nickel between ferritic FeCr substrates and nickel-containing anodes is known to be a key factor for rapid cell degradation.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: The main concern of the present work was to develop a diffusion barrier layer between a sintered composite comprising a ferritic FeCr substrate and a Ni/YSZ anode to avoid interdiffusion during cell fabrication as well as during electrochemical operation.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Model experiments were carried out with Cr2O3/Cr2MnO4, Ce0.8Gd0.2O2 and CeO2 diffusion barriers.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: In sintering experiments at 1100 degrees C for 3 hours in argon atmosphere Ce0.8Gd0.2O2 and CeO2 displayed promising results by completely avoiding any interdiffusion.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: Due to the higher electrical conductivity CeO2 was chosen for the electrochemical cell tests.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: SOFCs comprising an FeCr substrate, a CeO2 diffusion barrier layer and a sintered Ni/YSZ anode were coated with a 9.5YSZ electrolyte by the vacuum-plasma-spraying technique.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: The thickness of the electrolyte was 60 mu m. A LSCF cathode was then screen printed.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C a power 2 2 density of 430 mW/cm(2) was achieved.
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC

Sentencas: No significant voltage drop was observed during operation for 165 h at 0.3 A/cm(2).
Titulo: Electrically conductive diffusion barrier layers for metal-supported SOFC
